III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
The facility is not contracted with the DHHS and is not subject to ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The facility is not contracted with the DHHS and is not subject to DHHS contract/policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 400.10115 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
A facility shall document that each employee and each
volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or more hours per
week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free from
communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 3-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 3 years after the last
verification.
Dates of staff’s current TB test completion and pending updates were documented
for all employees on one form. It is recommended that each employees TB test
results be present within their personnel file at time of licensing review.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has not been required to submit a corrective action plan during this report
period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
